How can I retrieve the history of an identity on the Verus network?

You can use the `getidentityhistory` command to retrieve the history of an identity on the Verus network. The command takes several arguments, including the identity's name or i-address, a start height, an end height, and options to include transaction proofs and specify the height for generating a proof.

getidentityhistory "name@ || iid" (heightstart) (heightend) (txproofs) (txproofheight)

Arguments
  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) name followed by "@" or i-address of an identity
  "heightstart"            (number, optional) default=0, only return content from this height forward, inclusive
  "heightend"             (number, optional) default=0 which means max height, only return content up to this height,
                                inclusive. -1 means also return values from the mempool.
  "txproofs"              (bool, optional) default=false, if true, returns proof of ID
  "txproofheight"           (number, optional) default="height", height from which to generate a proof

Result:

Examples:
> verus getidentityhistory "name@"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentityhistory", "params": ["name@"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

What are the required and optional arguments for the `getidentityhistory` command?

The `getidentityhistory` command requires one argument, which is the identity's name followed by "@" or its i-address. The optional arguments include:

* `heightstart`: the starting block height for the history (default is 0)
* `heightend`: the ending block height for the history (default is 0, which means the current block height; -1 includes the mempool)
* `txproofs`: a boolean indicating whether to include transaction proofs (default is false)
* `txproofheight`: the height from which to generate a proof (default is the current block height)

getidentityhistory "name@ || iid" (heightstart) (heightend) (txproofs) (txproofheight)

Arguments
  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) name followed by "@" or i-address of an identity
  "heightstart"            (number, optional) default=0, only return content from this height forward, inclusive
  "heightend"             (number, optional) default=0 which means max height, only return content up to this height,
                                inclusive. -1 means also return values from the mempool.
  "txproofs"              (bool, optional) default=false, if true, returns proof of ID
  "txproofheight"           (number, optional) default="height", height from which to generate a proof

Result:

Examples:
> verus getidentityhistory "name@"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentityhistory", "params": ["name@"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How can I use the `getidentityhistory` command to retrieve the history of an identity, including transaction proofs?

To retrieve the history of an identity, including transaction proofs, you can use the `getidentityhistory` command with the `txproofs` argument set to true. For example:

`verus getidentityhistory "name@" true`

This command will retrieve the history of the identity "name@" and include transaction proofs.

getidentityhistory "name@ || iid" (heightstart) (heightend) (txproofs) (txproofheight)

Can I use the `getidentityhistory` command to retrieve the history of an identity from a specific block height range?

Yes, you can use the `getidentityhistory` command to retrieve the history of an identity from a specific block height range by specifying the `heightstart` and `heightend` arguments. For example:

`verus getidentityhistory "name@" 100 200 true`

This command will retrieve the history of the identity "name@" from block height 100 to 200, inclusive, and include transaction proofs.

getidentityhistory "name@ || iid" (heightstart) (heightend) (txproofs) (txproofheight)
